Comment: Censoring books in school is very old.    In my youth, it was Educational Research Analysts founded by Mel and Norma Gabler. The Gablers would make a “bill of particulars” listing everything in a textbooks that they didn’t like. They would present their lists at textbook adoption meetings in Texas.    These meetings were supposed to be a formality since the texts had already been vetted by professionals. The Gablers essentially hijacked the meetings and would list, page by page, everything they found wrong with each book. It got to the point that the School Board and publishers would accept all of their recommendations simply because nobody wanted to be trapped in an unending meeting from hell.   Publishers back then would generally make only one printing of the book so these two and their supporters essentially controlled what was in textbooks in the entire United States for decades.
